title: 108_s2287
content:
The Act is titled the "Jean Lafitte National Historical Park and Preserve Boundary Adjustment Act of 2004". It involves adjusting the boundaries of the Jean Lafitte National Historical Park and Preserve. The National Parks and Recreation Act of 1978 is amended to adjust the boundaries of the Barataria Preserve Unit in the Jean Lafitte National Historical Park and Preserve. The amendment involves changing the acreage from 20,000 to 23,000 acres as depicted on a new map dated August 2002. Additionally, the Secretary is granted the authority to acquire land for the Barataria preserve unit. The Secretary is authorized to acquire land, water, and interests within the Barataria Preserve Unit by donation, purchase, transfer, or exchange. Federal land in specific areas must be transferred to the National Park Service without consideration. The Secretary is authorized to acquire land, water, and interests within the Barataria Preserve Unit by donation, purchase, transfer, or exchange. Federal land in specific areas may be acquired with the owner's consent. Federal land transferred under certain conditions shall be subject to agreed-upon easements. The Secretary can acquire land, water, and interests in the Barataria Preserve Unit through donation, purchase, transfer, or exchange. Specific areas may be acquired with the owner's consent, and transferred federal land must adhere to agreed-upon easements. The Secretary is required to preserve and protect fresh water drainage patterns, vegetative cover, ecological and biological systems, and water and air quality within the unit. The National Parks and Recreation Act of 1978 is being amended to address hunting, fishing, and trapping regulations within the Barataria Preserve Unit. The Secretary is granted authority to acquire land, water, and interests in the unit, with a focus on preserving fresh water drainage patterns, vegetative cover, ecological systems, and water and air quality. Amendments include redesignating subsections and clarifying administrative procedures. SEC. 3. REFERENCES IN LAW.

Any reference in a law to the Barataria Marsh Unit is now considered a reference to the Barataria Preserve Unit, and any reference to the Jean Lafitte National Historical Park is now considered a reference to the Jean Lafitte National Historical Park and Preserve. Conforming amendments have been made to the National Parks and Recreation Act of 1978 to reflect these changes. The Senate passed the document on September 15, 2004. Attest: EMILY J. REYNOLDS, Secretary.
